application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

titleStmt.title: Stochastic Hillclimbing as a Baseline Method for Evaluating Genetic Algorithms

affiliation.orgName: Department of Mathematics University of California at Berkeleyt
Department of Mathematics University of California at Berkeleyt

analytic.title: Stochastic Hillclimbing as a Baseline Method for Evaluating Genetic Algorithms

abstract.p: We investigate the effectiveness of stochastic hillclimbing as a baseline for evaluating the performance of genetic algorithms (GAs) as combinato-rial function optimizers. In particular, we address two problems to which GAs have been applied in the literature: Koza's ll-multiplexer problem and the jobshop problem. We demonstrate that simple stochastic hill-climbing methods are able to achieve results comparable or superior to those obtained by the GAs designed to address these two problems. We further illustrate, in the case of the jobshop problem, how insights obtained in the formulation of a stochastic hillclimbing algorithm can lead to improvements in the encoding used by a GA.
